name: ADONIS
lifecycle_notes: Two broods; larvae tended by ants
general_description: Bright blue male with dark borders; females brown. Flutters low over grasslands, mutualistic with ants.

name: AFRICAN GIANT SWALLOWTAIL
lifecycle_notes: Males mud-puddle; life history poorly documented
general_description: World's largest swallowtail; orange-black pattern. Toxic, rarely descends from canopy.

name: AMERICAN SNOOT
lifecycle_notes: Single brood; larvae sequester pipevine toxins
general_description: Iridescent blue-green hindwings; slow flight. 'Snout' from elongated palpi.

name: AN 88
lifecycle_notes: Multiple broods; larvae feed in groups
general_description: Black-and-white '88' pattern on hindwing underside. Swift flier in humid forests.

name: APPOLLO
general_description: White wings with red eyespots; slow, gliding flight. Threatened by climate change.

name: ATALA
general_description: Iridescent teal body, red abdomen. Rebounding from near-extinction via host plant conservation.

name: BANDED ORANGE HELICONIAN
general_description: Orange with black bands; mimics toxic species. Common in sunny clearings.

name: BANDED PEACOCK
general_description: White bands on brown wings; large eyespots. Bounces low in open areas.

name: BECKERS WHITE
lifecycle_notes: Multiple broods; fast development in heat";
general_description: White with green marbling; desert specialist. Visits damp soil for minerals.

name: BLACK HAIRSTREAK
general_description: Brown with orange spots; hindwing tails. Rare, dependent on unmanaged hedgerows.

name: BLUE MORPHO
lifecycle_notes: Larvae hairy; adults fly in canopy light gaps
general_description: Iridescent blue dorsal; cryptic brown underside. Flaps lazily, startling predators with flash color.

name: BLUE SPOTTED CROW
general_description: Dark brown with electric blue spots; slow flight. Poisonous to birds.

name: BROWN SIPROETA
general_description: Orange-brown with black bands; white spots. Visits fruit more than flowers.

name: CABBAGE WHITE
general_description: White with black wingtips (female: two spots). Abundant urban immigrant.

name: CAIRNS BIRDWING
general_description: Male yellow-green; female larger, black-white-yellow. Australia's largest endemic butterfly.

name: CHECQUERED SKIPPER
lifecycle_notes: One brood; larvae build leaf shelters
general_description: Gold-chequered brown; rapid darting flight. Basks on low perches.

name: CHESTNUT
general_description: Chestnut brown with white bands; toxic. Mimics tiger patterns.

name: CLEOPATRA
general_description: Lemon-yellow male; female pale green. Angular wings resemble leaves.

name: CLODIUS PARNASSIAN
general_description: Semi-transparent white; red-spotted wings. Glides above alpine flowers.

name: CLOUDED SULPHUR
general_description: Pale yellow with dark borders; pink-edged female form. Visits legumes.

name: COMMON BANDED AWL
general_description: Dark brown with iridescent blue bands; hooked antennae. Dawn/dusk flier.

name: COMMON WOOD-NYMPH
general_description: Brown with yellow-ringed eyespots; erratic flight. Feeds on sap/rot fruit.

name: COPPER TAIL
general_description: Violet-blue with copper hindwing margin; small. Basks with wings open.

name: CRECENT
general_description: Orange-black crescents on hindwing; rapid low flight. Forms late-summer aggregations.

name: CRIMSON PATCH
general_description: Black with crimson bands; white-spotted. Slow, confident flight (toxic).

name: DANAID EGGFLY
general_description: Female mimics Monarch; male black with white-blue spots. Aggressive territoriality.

name: EASTERN COMA
general_description: Orange with dark spots; deeply scalloped wings. Visits tree sap more than flowers.

name: EASTERN DAPPLE WHITE
general_description: White with green marbling; pink wing bases. Declining due to habitat loss.

name: EASTERN PINE ELFIN
general_description: Rusty brown with faint bands; short tails. Camouflages perfectly on pine needles.

name: ELBOWED PIERROT
general_description: Black with white bands; 'elbowed' hindwing shape. Flits near host shrubs.

name: GOLD BANDED
general_description: Male golden yellow; female greenish-white. Slow, floating flight.

name: GREAT EGGFLY
general_description: Male iridescent blue; female mimics toxic species. Known for male-killing parasite resistance.

name: GREAT JAY
general_description: Pale green bands on black; long tails. Patrols canopy edges.

name: GREEN CELLED CATTLEHEART
general_description: Black with green cells; pink abdomen. Toxic, slow-fluttering.

name: GREY HAIRSTREAK
lifecycle_notes: Multiple broods; larvae pest on crops
general_description: Gray-brown with orange cap; hindwing tails wiggle to mimic antennae. Ubiquitous generalist.

name: INDRA SWALLOW
lifecycle_notes: One brood; larvae on desert parsleys

name: IPHICLUS SISTER
general_description: Brown with white band; orange tips. Glides along shaded ravines.

name: JULIA
general_description: Bright orange male; female duller. Longwings form feeding aggregations.

name: LARGE MARBLE
lifecycle_notes: One brood; larvae on mustard family
general_description: White with green marbling; declining rapidly. Requires intact native flora.

name: MALACHITE
lifecycle_notes: Larvae spiny; adults feed on fruit/decay
general_description: Large with light green patches like malachite stone. Slow, sailing flight.

name: MANGROVE SKIPPER
general_description: Iridescent blue-black; red head. Important mangrove ecosystem indicator.

name: MESTRA
general_description: White bands on orange; erratic flight. Expands range during wet periods.

name: METALMARK
general_description: Shiny blue-green spots; small. Basks on sunlit stones near water.

name: MILBERTS TORTOISESHELL
general_description: Orange band bordered by black/yellow; scalloped wings. Visits mud/sap.

name: MONARCH
general_description: Iconic orange-black-white pattern. Famous for continental migration; declining due to habitat loss :cite[6].

name: MOURNING CLOAK
general_description: Maroon with cream border; blue spots. Emerges early spring; feeds on tree sap.

name: ORANGE OAKLEAF
general_description: Brilliant blue-orange above; cryptic leaf-mimic below. Disappears when wings closed.

name: ORANGE TIP
general_description: Male white with orange wingtips; female all white. Visits spring blossoms.

name: ORCHARD SWALLOW
general_description: Black with white spots; large. Common in gardens; larvae pest on citrus.

name: PAINTED LADY
general_description: Orange-pink with black-white spots. Most widespread butterfly; 9,000-mile migration :cite[1].

name: PAPER KITE
lifecycle_notes: Slow-flying; larvae feed on toxic vines
general_description: Translucent white with black veins; slow flight. Often bred in conservatories.

name: PEACOCK
lifecycle_notes: Hibernates as adult; eyespots startle predators
general_description: Vivid eyespots on red wings. Hisses by rubbing wings to deter birds.

name: PINE WHITE
general_description: White with black veins; flutters high in canopy. Occasionally defoliates pines.

name: PIPEVINE SWALLOW
general_description: Black with iridescent blue hindwings; red spots below. Model for mimicry complexes.

name: POPINJAY
general_description: Black with large translucent windows; long tails. Elusive, shade-loving.

name: PURPLE HAIRSTREAK
general_description: Male purple above; female black. Rarely descends; feeds on honeydew.

name: PURPLISH COPPER
general_description: Male copper-purple; female orange with spots. Basks low in grasses.

name: QUESTION MARK
lifecycle_notes: Hibernates as adult; two seasonal forms
general_description: Deeply scalloped wings; silver '?' mark below. Feeds on rotting fruit/sap.

name: RED ADMIRAL
general_description: Black with red bands; white spots. Territorial; visits sap/flowers.

name: RED CRACKER
general_description: Gray camouflage with blue rings; males produce loud 'crack'. Perches vertically on trees.

name: RED POSTMAN
general_description: Black with red bands; toxic. Co-mimic with Heliconius melpomene.

name: RED SPOTTED PURPLE
general_description: Iridescent blue-black; red spots below. Glides with wings flat.

name: SCARCE SWALLOW
general_description: Pale yellow with tiger stripes; long tails. Protected in parts of Europe.

name: SILVER SPOT SKIPPER
general_description: Brown with silver spots; rapid flight. Specialist of short-turf grasslands.

name: SLEEPY ORANGE
general_description: Bright orange with dark borders; sluggish flight. Visits low flowers.

name: SOOTYWING
general_description: Dark brown with white spots; tiny. Often seen on bare ground/roads.

name: SOUTHERN DOGFACE
general_description: Yellow 'dog head' profile on forewing; rapid flight. Forms migrating swarms.

name: STRAITED QUEEN
lifecycle_notes: Sequesters toxins; less migratory than Monarch
general_description: Chestnut brown with white spots; toxic. Males patrol for females with pheromones.

name: TROPICAL LEAFWING
general_description: Leaf-mimic when closed; orange above. Flies only when disturbed.

name: TWO BARRED FLASHER
general_description: Brown with two white bars; emits bright flash when taking flight.

name: ULYSES
general_description: Electric blue with black borders; iconic Queenslander. Protected by CITES.

name: VICEROY
general_description: Orange with black lines; white dots on borders. Tastier than Monarch but avoided via mimicry.

name: WOOD SATYR
general_description: Brown with eyespots; slow flight. Basks on sunlit paths.

name: YELLOW SWALLOW TAIL
general_description: Black with yellow bands; largest US swallowtail. Defends by extruding osmeterium.

name: ZEBRA LONG WING
general_description: Black with yellow stripes; slow wingbeats. Roosts communally; toxic.
